name: 1,4-naphthalenedione, 2-chloro-3-hydroxy-
Reason: The target compound 1,4-naphthalenedione, 2-chloro-3-hydroxy- consists of a naphthalene basic unit, which has a higher melting point compared to benzene due to increased molecular complexity and intermolecular interactions. Taking naphthalene's melting point as a reference (around 80), the additional functional groups will modify this base value. The diketone (two C=O groups) will likely increase the melting point due to strong polar interactions and possible hydrogen bonding (each may add about +40 to +50). The hydroxyl (-OH) group will also increase the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds (+30). The chlorine atom contributes to the melting point through its inductive effect and the increase in molecular mass, which might add around +20. Collectively, these substituent effects are expected to significantly increase the melting point compared to the base structure of naphthalene.
